headline: President Trump trades barbs with Democrats over partial government shutdown as battle over border funding continues
subHeadline: Trump stands firm on border wall demands; Nancy Pelosi says the president is using scare tactics.

utterances.sentences: But I do agree.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Does she drink a little coffee, a little.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: She has a little coffee and a little wine, and my mother is in great health, so.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How do you mean little, what is little?

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Two glasses of wine tops -- one usually, and two or three cups of coffee.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Every day?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: That's what they say, the study says Lawrence two cups of coffee, couple of drinks that's what I do -- I like it.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think it's fine but I think you've got to watch it. I think there is a real addiction problem with some people out there that they can't -- they don't know what moderation is. But I love a little glass of wine every other day, maybe?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Every other day?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Maybe every -- well OK, every.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: How about two full-on whiskeys a night, that's my game.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You do (ph) whiskey?

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: I worry about people drinking too much, and I am very cautious having seen some of my friends suffer grievously as a result.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Well Dana, it's about moderation that's what the two drinks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I know the thing is though that moderation is -- just depends, like sometimes they'll say like, "one drink a week is moderate."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Yes that's.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not moderate to me.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: It's a little much, I like to wake up with my coffee, I like to have a drink when I go home.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No that is moderate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't drink coffee -- I like tea.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: No coffee -- tea.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: The problem is there's some people wake up with a glass of wine, that's the problem.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well yes, but that's not what the study was about.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: How about this.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Yes but there are people -- that's the real world people who have that problem.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Districts -- school districts across the U.S. are banning homework after complaints of students being overloaded. Some classrooms have stopped assigning it altogether while others are saying, "homework can't be handed out on weekends and during school vacations," other districts have just stopped grading homework. I like this.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: These backpacks are too big, Lawrence.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes -- you all have eight hours with kids every single day -- every single day. I'm not saying some homework isn't OK, but all of these homeworks these kids are stressing out over this homework. They can't spend time with their family, by the way can you all just let the kids go outside? That's why we have an obesity problem, because you don't let the kids go outside -- you sit them there, and most of the times you don't teach. You put them in front of a computer, the iPads today -- and then you want the parents -- with you teaching them stuff that -- not the same style that the parents learned from, you want them to sit down and stress over homework instead of spending time with their parents.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think that's what makes our country what it is, it's what I did -- it's what most kids did. It's part of discipline and what it takes to be a success in this world. I played sports badly.

utterances.speaker: SCILLUE
utterances.sentences: You're the mean principal Tom.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: No I'm not, I'm a rational American who is proud of what this country is all about. And given our performance relative to other nations on things like science, I think we need more.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think the problem is that in our schools they're not teaching science, and math, and reading.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Bingo.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They're teaching about what -- how you feel and what your gender is that day.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, social justice.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So maybe if they would focus on basic principles of learning and education, both K through 12 and in college then they wouldn't have so much homework at home.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I don't.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Also I don't think Doug had his as young as -- when you were young, in grammar school you didn't have a lot of homework did you?

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, I went to Hunter Elementary School.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Oh OK, yes.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: You can look it up.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: He was really -- all right you're a big success.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: We had homework, trust me.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: What's that Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why aren't we for letting the teacher decide? (ph)

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This just sounds like a mandate, like why not let teachers -- let them figure it out.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: They can't figure it out because they have all of this testing that needs to be done.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: And the state.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'll tell you that when I got home from school, I liked to play school.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Oh you wanted more of it. Wow.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: You gave out homework. OK, Air Canada causing a controversy after a Christmas Eve flight that was halfway to Hawaii was forced to turn back due to a maintenance issue. Why not just go the whole way? One passenger claims she was only given a $10 food voucher for the trouble. The airline saying it also gave passengers a discount for future travel, free meals onboard and a special buffet meal at the gate -- that's what I want when I arrive at the gate, a buffet meal. Right, Katie?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And the buffet - the buffet's like, "Do you want to some old pretzels, maybe some peanuts? Do you want some old chips?" I don't know.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, this is a problem of customer service. There's a growing trend in this country. They don't understand customer service.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, airlines have never cared, really (ph).

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No, they -

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: It's getting worse and worse, much worse.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Like just give everybody free food. That's pretty simple.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But what kind of food, Lawrence? Because -

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Edible food would help.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: - I'm sorry, the pretzels aren't good.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Don't you want to just land in Hawaii, you can fix it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm sure that the pilot probably had a good reason, right. They wouldn't do it for - I don't think they - they're not stupid people, obviously, they're flying a plane. But here's what I'm for in 2019, I am done with people complaining about their travel on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm going to unfollow them.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: I don't even believe this woman. She says all I got -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I started - my Twitter following was started by my complaining about the Oscilla (ph), or my observations on the Oscilla (ph). I didn't always complain.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: They're getting a lot better on the Oscilla (ph).

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: So you used to do it, but you don't do it anymore?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, it just - it got to be too - I did it as sort of a laugh. Like I would like obverse people, like people like that bumped their head on the train, whatever.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: To me, it's competitiveness.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But complaining and trying to shame -

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: America can't move people like other countries. It's sad, it's a problem, and it goes back to how our country's being run.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying that trying to shame a company on Twitter because you're a blue checkmark is pathetic.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, that is a little -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I am - I am done with you

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Do you know how many followers I have?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So Dana has a point, because there are actually people working hard to try and - I mean there is a - there will be a flight attendant here and there who doesn't treat you well, but overall, people are trying to get the done job and get you where you need to go.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Don't get crazy on us.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Public shaming is not always the best option. Sometimes it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right it's time now for One More Thing, I'm going to go first -- you know the thing I get asked the most after Christmas is what did Jasper get? I'll show you what Jasper got, this is Peter's son Barry (ph) - - he's visiting from Scotland. And he and Peter shared a porterhouse for two, but there was leftovers so Jasper got handfed one by one, on Christmas eve.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Very fancy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then the next day we had to take a big, long walk around Central Park. Took a little stop there to get a picture of Barry and Jasper, that's Jasper's favorite Uncle Barry. He's having a great Christmas.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Cute bowtie too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed. Oh that was from Carl Rove (ph), thank you Carl Rove for the bowtie, and happy belated birthday -- birthday was yesterday. Doug?

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: You know my One More Thing is Brady Singer, a prospect in the Kansas City Royal Organization who did a very, very good thing and paid off the mortgage of his parents, and said I couldn't have done this but for you. And really, holiday values to me -- whether you be Christian, Jewish -- whatever, really reflect family, family loyalty, commitment to really enduring values and to me Brady Singer represents everything as we'll hear that America's.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's true I read a study yesterday that you feel better for longer, the more you give rather than the more you receive.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Tom?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: ‘Tis better to give than receive, I agree. How about this, this is the most conscientious rock musician I have ever seen, he's the lead singer of a band, it's People Who Could Fly -- the band mates name is James Mills. He's taken a hot solo here, and in the middle of his guitar solo he -- a girl loses her balloon and he grabs it, look at how he works -- watch him again. He's playing the hot solo, she loses the balloon, he gives it right back to her.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's pretty great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Smooth moves, man.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's pretty great.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Oh that's pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What kind of music do they play?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: They're standard rock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Standard.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You listen to (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: I don't know, I just saw the video, I thought it was great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I like the video -- I like the video, Lawrence?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: All right, so I got two One More Things, so.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh is that how you're going to roll now that you're a contributor at Fox News? Congratulations -- oh I'm sorry I stepped on.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes you stole it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because you're so excited that you're here.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm part of the family finally.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry we're so happy to have you. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: You took my second one. You know that this new thing about gender reveal, it's this cool way of announcing to everyone the gender of the child that you're going to have. But you've got to nail it or the internet is going to get you. This dad, look what he does. And he misses the shot -- how do you miss the shot? The gold is right there, and it ended up being a girl. And so this dad is embarrassed, they're destroying them on the internet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why did he put it on the internet?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: He must not watch "The Five" enough to know that we make fun of gender reveals.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You do?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It is so cool.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: One caused a wildfire in Arizona.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In Arizona, that was very bad.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Then you got to be smart about it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That was very bad.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: What was his reveal? If he hit it it was a boy, if he missed it was a girl?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No it was just supposed to hit the backboard and then.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But you know what we're glad they're having a baby girl.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: I mean, you have a baby -- you either know the gender or you don't.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: You're taking the fun away.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: What's the fun of shooting a basketball.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Because it's an exciting moment.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible)

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: It makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: He doesn't get invited to our gender reveal party.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: I guess not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Katie's next.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK so I also have two, I'll be in tomorrow for Ainsley Earhardt on "Fox and Friends" in the morning, bright and early (inaudible). So I can see you there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So you're burning the midnight oil.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, and my second One More Thing, Lawrence started a trend is look -- I'm not a surfer, always wish that I was but hundreds of Santa Clauses left their sleighs at home and took their surfboards to the waves this past Monday for an annual Santa Surf in Cocoa Beach, Florida. It's pretty cool, I feel like you might drown in that outfit, but they made it through. The yearly tradition is a part of a fundraiser for the Florida Surf Museum and also a charity for cancer patients that has been continuing off the Florida coast for an entire decade. About $40,000 was raised this year as thousands of spectators cheered on the surfers, donned in their best Santa suits, elf costumes and Christmas sweaters. So taking the Christmas charity to the beach.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Santa's got balance.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: that's pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Douglas just wants to give them all homework.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: On Christmas break.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: If you've got thousands of people there, couldn't you raise more than $40,000?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Surfers are cheap, Doug.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: Apparently so.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Doug is the Grinch today.

utterances.speaker: SHOEN
utterances.sentences: I'm not a Grinch, I want to raise money for causes -- magnificent.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right everyone, happy boxing day, set your DVRs never miss an episode of THE FIVE, "Special Report" is up next. Hey, Bret Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 ASC Services II Media, LLC.
